titleStmt.title: The changeable Covenant. Shewing in a brief series of relation, how the Scots from time to time have imposed upon England, by their false glosses, and perverse interpretations of the Covenant. Their jugglings, tergiversations, and dangerous designes against the Parliament of England, under pretence of the Covenant, articles, and treaty.
titleStmt.author: May, Thomas, 1595-1650.

titleStmt.title: The changeable Covenant. Shewing in a brief series of relation, how the Scots from time to time have imposed upon England, by their false glosses, and perverse interpretations of the Covenant. Their jugglings, tergiversations, and dangerous designes against the Parliament of England, under pretence of the Covenant, articles, and treaty.
titleStmt.author: May, Thomas, 1595-1650.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G.D. for Thomas Brewster and Gregory Moule, at the three Bibles at the west ende of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
